p: In Mayotte, the French overseas territory that belongs to the Comoros archipelago, a retrospective study conducted in 2008 confirmed the presence of the disease with 10 human cases infected with RVFV strains genetically closely linked to the 2006â€“2007 Kenyan isolates [16]. It was also found that the Mayotte livestock has been infected by RVFV prior to 2004 [17]. Regarding the Union of Comoros, in 2011, Roger et al. reported widespread exposure of Comorian livestock with 32.8% of animals shown to be RVFV-seropositive without any notifications of massive abortions or abnormal mortality in the younger animals by the Comorian Animal Health Services. However, the origin of this infection remains unknown [18].
